# The `IRSimilarityCandidate` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is a class that wraps a range of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> from one point to another in the vector of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a>, which is a region of the program. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

## Description {#details}

This is a class that wraps a range of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> from one point to another in the vector of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a>, which is a region of the program.

It is also responsible for defining the structure within this region of instructions.

The structure of a region is defined through a value numbering system assigned to each unique value in a region at the creation of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a>.

For example, for each <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> we add a mapping for each new value seen in that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>. IR: Mapping Added: add1 = add i32 a, c1 add1 -&gt; 3, a -&gt; 1, c1 -&gt; 2 add2 = add i32 a, %1 add2 -&gt; 4 add3 = add i32 c2, c1 add3 -&gt; 6, c2 -&gt; 5

We can compare IRSimilarityCandidates against one another. The <a href="#a23d2b4941adb672f1a2ce945399065e3">isSimilar</a> function compares each <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> against one another and if we have the same sequences of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> that would create the same hash, we have similar IRSimilarityCandidates.

We can also compare the structure of IRSimilarityCandidates. If we can create a mapping of registers in the region contained by one <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> to the region contained by different <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a>, they can be considered structurally similar.

IRSimilarityCandidate1: IRSimilarityCandidate2: add1 = add i32 a, b add1 = add i32 d, e add2 = add i32 a, c add2 = add i32 d, f add3 = add i32 c1, c2 add3 = add i32 c3, c4

Can have the following mapping from candidate to candidate of: a -&gt; d, b -&gt; e, c -&gt; f, c1 -&gt; c3, c2 -&gt; c4 and can be considered similar.

IRSimilarityCandidate1: IRSimilarityCandidate2: add1 = add i32 a, b add1 = add i32 d, c4 add2 = add i32 a, c add2 = add i32 d, f add3 = add i32 c1, c2 add3 = add i32 c3, c4

We cannot create the same mapping since the use of c4 is not used in the same way as b or c2.

Definition at line 653 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/irsimilarityidentifier-h">IRSimilarityIdentifier.h</a>.

### createCanonicalRelationFrom() {#aee1383f060f0db621671d555250dd7f3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::IRSimilarity::IRSimilarityCandidate::createCanonicalRelationFrom (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp; SourceCand, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt; unsigned, unsigned &gt; &amp; OneToOne, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt; unsigned, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/denseset">DenseSet</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; &gt; &amp; ToSourceMapping, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt; unsigned, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/denseset">DenseSet</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; &gt; &amp; FromSourceMapping)</>}>
Create a mapping for the value numbering of the calling <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a>, to a different separate set of numbers, based on the canonical ordering in <code>SourceCand</code>.

These are defined based on the found mappings in <code>ToSourceMapping</code> and <code>FromSourceMapping</code>. Both of these relationships should have the same information, just in opposite directions. Uses the <code>OneToOne</code> mapping from target candidate to <code>SourceCand</code> GVNs to determine the mapping first for values with multiple mappings. This mapping is created by the ordering of operands in the instruction they are first seen in the candidates.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[inout] SourceCand">- The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> to create a canonical numbering from.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[inout] OneToOne">- A mapping of value numbers from candidate <code>A</code> to candidate \\B using the structure of the original instructions.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ToSourceMapping">- The mapping of value numbers from this candidate to <code>SourceCand</code>.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="FromSourceMapping">- The mapping of value numbers from <code>SoureCand</code> to this candidate.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/irsimilarityidentifier-h/#l00871">871</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/irsimilarityidentifier-h">IRSimilarityIdentifier.h</a>.

Create a mapping for the value numbering of the calling <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a>, to a different separate set of numbers, based on the canonical ordering in <code>SourceCand</code>.

These are defined based on the canonical mapping defined between <code>SoureCandLarge</code> and <code>TargetCandLarge</code>. These IRSimilarityCandidates are already structurally similar, and fully encapsulate the IRSimilarityCandidates in question. These are used as a &quot;bridge&quot; from the <code>SourceCand</code> to the target.

## Public Static Functions

### checkRelativeLocations() {#aa8a8f00e0169503c48f26bffcf4d6646}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool IRSimilarityCandidate::checkRelativeLocations (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/relativelocmapping">RelativeLocMapping</a> A, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/relativelocmapping">RelativeLocMapping</a> B)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Compare the relative locations in <code>A</code> and <code>B</code> and check that the distances match if both locations are contained in the region, and that the branches both point outside the region if they do not.

Example <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/region">Region</a>: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">entry:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br i1 %0, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;3</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">block&#95;0:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br i1 %0, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;2</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">block&#95;1:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br i1 %0, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;3</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">block&#95;2:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br i1 %1, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;4</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">block&#95;3:</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">  br i1 %2, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;5</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
 If we compare the branches in block&#95;0 and block&#95;1 the relative values are 1 and 2 for both, so we consider this a match.

If we compare the branches in entry and block&#95;0 the relative values are 2 and 3, and 1 and 2 respectively. Since these are not the same we do not consider them a match.

If we compare the branches in block&#95;1 and block&#95;2 the relative values are 1 and 2, and -1 and None respectively. As a result we do not consider these to be the same

If we compare the branches in block&#95;2 and block&#95;3 the relative values are -1 and None for both. We do consider these to be a match.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="A">- The first IRInstructionCandidate, relative location value, and incoming block.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="B">- The second IRInstructionCandidate, relative location value, and incoming block.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the relative locations match.
</SectionUser>

</MemberDefinition>

### createCanonicalMappingFor() {#ab887db0898db0bfae23199acc51e4f48}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void IRSimilarityCandidate::createCanonicalMappingFor (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp; CurrCand)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a mapping from the value numbering to a different separate set of numbers.

This will serve as a guide for relating one candidate to another. The canonical number gives use the ability identify which global value number in one candidate relates to the global value number in the other.

### overlap() {#ad02bc9bd1feca133eb84b3618e93fb37}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool IRSimilarityCandidate::overlap (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp; B)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Compare the start and end indices of the two IRSimilarityCandidates for whether they overlap.

If the start instruction of one <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> is less than the end instruction of the other, and the start instruction of one is greater than the start instruction of the other, they overlap.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the IRSimilarityCandidates do not have overlapping instructions.
</SectionUser>
